comment: This guy posts sometimes outright wrong lectures that he recorded (or stole from another professor) almost a decade ago. He will routinely forget about deadlines and/or have them set up wrong and to compound this he will take upwards of a week to email you back (if he even does at all).  His grading scales are vague at best. Avoid taking him.

The dean should be contacted about this professor. I'm starting to think the dean alreadys knows but refuses to do anything. This professor puts forward 0 effort in class and often has the wrong dates and even year posted for assignments. He does not promptly respond to emails. Don't think just because it is online you will be fine, YOU WONT!

Take the in-person night classes. Kennesaw State University should be ashamed to employ this professor. "weak conclusion" is his way of saying eh, I don't want to grade this thoroughly. Don't plan on actually learning anything in this course if you take it with him. I am genuinely impressed he gets away with this.

Uses another professors lectures. The videos are glitchy and presented in an uninteresting and dull way. If you email him with questions he will often be snarky and condescending. Likes to email students telling them not to be lazy, while he puts almost no effort into the class.

Not the best teacher, one of my worst in fact. However, there have been a few moments where the professor did help out. As long as the question is good, and you do the extra work you are guaranteed an A. However, the grade given in this class are not usually justified. If you do want to learn SolidWorks Flow simulation find someone else.

If you're looking to actually learn and understand CAD simulations this professor is not for you. He copied the entire course layout from a previous professor. He didn't answer emails until after the 4th week of class. His grading is inconsistent, and when he does respond to emails is very condescending. Avoid if possible.
Terrible teacher. He does not help and uses syllabus/lecture videos from a different professor. For assignments there was no clear and forward explanation of how concepts and procedures.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Okay this professor literally sucks! There is NO input from him for CAE class and answers all emails by read the textbook. Well if I can just read the textbook and learn everything, why do I pay tuition and have a professor to teach me? Do your job properly. Do yourself a favor and dont take him, unless you wanna teach yourself and still get a F

Imagine not having a professor, cause you teach yourself. A joke of a professor, unprofessional, rude when asking a normal question, doesn't grade assignments till 9 weeks later, doesn't respond to email. He marks for items not mentioned in the assignment, if he wants to mark you down, he'll use "weak conclusion". Don't know why he wants to teach.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Should have listen to previous review. CAE or ME 4250 is asynchronous with him using someone's else lecture.

Took him for online CAE. He used another professor's instructional videos. Moved 2 homeworks up to be due on the same day as a project. When emailed to clarify questions about inconsistency between assignment and videos essentially told all students he would not answer questions and to figure it out on their own. Truly terrible and unreasonable.

THIS GUY WAS ONE OF MY FAVORITES. HE UPLOADS HIS POWERPOINTS THAT HE USES IN CLASS ONLINE FOR YOU TO FOLLOW WITH. ATTENDANCE IS NOT PART OF YOUR GRADE, BUT IF HE KNOWS YOU COME TO CLASS HE WILL INEVITABLY CURVE YOU AT THE END. QUIZZES ARE EXTRA CREDIT. OPEN BOOK TESTS. JUST SHOW UP AND YOU CAN EASILY PULL A B IF NOT AN A

This guy is great. Dont listen to the reviewer who gave him a 2. Material science will never be easier, as it was with him. One of the best professors at KSU. Open book tests. Quizzes are extra credit on top of 100% of the class grade. Drop lowest test. HW worth 30% of ur grade. TAKE HIM!!

He does not grade consistently, and he takes forever to get grades back. Moreover, he lost two homework assignments which homework is worth 30% of the grade and there were only 4 home works. On the positive side, he made quizzes worth 10% extra credit. Be prepared to be stressed out
